contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox peerage title |name=Baron Carbery |image=[[Image:Carbery.svg|200px|Arms of the Baron Carbery]] |blazon=''Quarterly 1st & 4th: Freke; 2nd & 3rd: Evans''<ref>Burke's 107th.</ref> |creation date=1715 |monarch= |peerage=[[Peerage of Ireland]] |first holder= |present holder= |remainder to=the 1st Baron father's [[heirs male]] [[heirs of the body|of the body]] lawfully begotten |subsidiary titles=Baronet Freke (1768) |heir apparent= |}} '''Baron Carbery''', of [[Barony of Carbery|Carbery]] in the County of Cork, is a title in the [[Peerage of Ireland]]. It was created in 1715 for [[George Evans, 1st Baron Carbery|George Evans]], with remainder to the heirs male of his father and namesake George Evans, a supporter of [[William III of England|William]] and [[Mary II of England|Mary]] during the [[Glorious Revolution]], who had earlier declined the offer of a [[peerage]]. After his elevation to the peerage Lord Carbery represented [[Westbury (UK Parliament constituency)|Westbury]] in the [[British House of Commons|House of Commons]]. He was succeeded by his eldest son, the second Baron. He also sat as [[Member of Parliament]] for [[Westbury (UK Parliament constituency)|Westbury]]. His grandson, the fourth Baron, briefly represented [[Rutland (UK Parliament constituency)|Rutland]] in Parliament. He was succeeded by his uncle, the fifth Baron. On his death the line of the eldest son of the first Baron failed. He was succeeded by his first cousin once removed, the sixth Baron, who had previously succeeded his father as second Baronet, of Castle Freke (see below). Lord Carbery sat in the [[British House of Lords|House of Lords]] as an [[Representative peer|Irish Representative Peer]] from 1824 to 1845. His nephew, the eighth Baron, was an Irish Representative Peer from 1891 to 1894. {{As of|2012}} the titles are held by the latter's great-great-grandson, the twelfth Baron, who succeeded his father in 2012. The '''Baronetcy''', of Castle Freke in the County of Cork, was created in the [[Baronetage of Ireland]] in 1768 for John Evans-Freke, son of Grace daughter and heiress of Sir [[Ralph Freke]], [[Freke baronets|1st Baronet of West Bilney Norfolk]]<ref name=JBB>John Burke, Sir Bernard Burke, ''A Genealogical and Heraldic History of the Extinct and Dormant Baronetcies'' 1841 London</ref> and the Hon. John Evans, younger son of the first Baron Carbery. On his death the title passed to his son, the second Baronet. In 1807 he succeeded his first cousin once removed as sixth Baron Carbery. The titles have remained united since. ==Barons Carbery (1715)== *[[George Evans, 1st Baron Carbery]] (1680–1749) *[[George Evans, 2nd Baron Carbery]] (died 1759) *George Evans, 3rd Baron Carbery (died 1783) *[[George Evans, 4th Baron Carbery]] (1766–1804) *John Evans, 5th Baron Carbery (1738–1807) *[[John Evans-Freke, 6th Baron Carbery]] (1765–1845) *George Patrick Percy Evans-Freke, 7th Baron Carbery (1810–1889) *[[William Charles Evans-Freke, 8th Baron Carbery]] (1812–1894) *Algernon William George Evans-Freke, 9th Baron Carbery (1868–1898) *John Evans-Freke, 10th Baron Carbery (1892–1970) *[[Peter Evans-Freke, 11th Baron Carbery|Peter Ralfe Harrington Evans-Freke, 11th Baron Carbery]]<ref> {{cite web | url = http://announcements.telegraph.co.uk/deaths/152424/carbery-11th-baron-peter-ralfe-harrington-evans-freke| title = Daily Telegraph Announcements - CARBERY - 11th Baron, Peter Ralfe Harrington EVANS-FREKE| accessdate = 2 August 2012}} </ref> (1920-2012) *Michael Peter Evans-Freke, 12th Baron Carbery (born 1942) The [[heir apparent]] is the present holder's son Hon Dominic Ralfe Cecil Evans-Freke (born 1969). The heir apparent's heir apparent is his son Benedict Robin Harrington Evans-Freke (born 2004). ==Freke, later Evans-Freke baronets, of Castle Freke (1768)== *Sir John Evans later Freke, 1st Baronet (died 1777) grandson of George Evans, 1st Baron Carbery and [[Sir Ralph Freke, 1st Baronet]] of West Bilney, Norfolk<ref name=JBB/> *Sir John Evans-Freke, 2nd Baronet (1765–1845) (succeeded as '''Baron Carbery''' in 1807) ''For further succession, see above'' ==References== {{Reflist}} *Kidd, Charles, Williamson, David (editors). ''Debrett's Peerage and Baronetage'' (1990 edition). New York: St Martin's Press, 1990. {{Barons of Ireland}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Carbery}} [[Category:Baronies in the Peerage of Ireland]] [[Category:1715 establishments in Ireland]]
